message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of coded computation over a wireless master-worker setup with straggling workers, which involves communication and information theory (cs.IT), distributed computing (cs.DC), networking and internet architecture (cs.NI), control systems (cs.SY), and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper proposes optimal coding schemes for minimizing latency in distributed computation of linear functions and mitigating the effect of stragglers, which is a problem in distributed computing (cs.DC) and machine learning (cs.LG). The paper also considers 3 asymptotic regimes and precisely characterizes the total run-time of the distributed algorithm and optimum coding strategy in each regime, which involves analysis and optimization (cs.IT, cs.SY). Overall, the paper spans multiple sub-categories of computer science, but cs.IT, cs.DC, cs.NI, cs.SY, and cs.LG are the most likely ones.
